description:
Found in `october2025/investigate1.md:294`

> integrate retriever + coverage + generator


---

## /benchmark/results.md
- Latency: 72 ms p95 (N=10k queries, Android NPU)
- Memory: 1.6 GB (RTD+PQ compressed corpus)
- Coverage@0.9: 0.985
- Uncited Claim Rate: 0.4%
- Proof size: 2.1 KB avg
- Verification time: 0.7 ms

---

## /ip/claims.md
1. Method Claim: Generating text conditioned on retrieved spans bundled with a cryptographic coverage certificate.
2. System Claim: Device implementing sketch-first pre-prune, PQ-ANN retriever, coverage assembler, and verifier.
3. Dependent Claims:
 - Co-trained sketch encoder.
 - Span-credit learner.
 - Dual-channel RTD+PQ.
 - Adaptive τ policies.
 - Verifier-gated decoding.
 - Attested runtime integration.
 - Proof branch deduplication.
 - Risk-aware fallback policies.

---

## /compliance/data_governance.md
- All data synthetic or public QA.
- No PII stored in RTD.
- DP noise applied during online learner updates.
- SPDX SBOM generated automatically.

---

## /next_steps.md
- [ ] Finalize Rust PQ kernel.
- [ ] Integrate verifier with Summit decoder.
- [ ] Expand evaluation harness with entailment checks.
- [ ] Draft provisional patent with full claims set.
- [ ] Reach out to OEM partners (Samsung, Qualcomm).
- [ ] Run enterprise pilot (finance/legal).
- [ ] Prepare compliance packet for audits.
- [ ] File PCT application within 12 months."}}

- Distinguish from PCC (Necula 1997): applied to code safety, not ML retrieval context.
- Distinguish from transparency logs (RFC6962): log commitments, not span-level coverage proofs.

---

## Next Steps
- Expand dependent claims for multi-lingual verifier, federated retriever updates, and GPU/NPU acceleration.
- Generate formal claim language for filing (US provisional → PCT).
- Align claim chart with Summit | IntelGraph | MC integration modules for industrial applicability."}}
